note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY – MECHANICAL DEBULKING OF CARCINOID

Patient: Jasmine Young, 39-year-old female
MRN: S31640-021
Date: 2024-11-19
Facility: Lakeshore University Hospital – Bronchoscopy Suite
Attending: Dr. Ahmed Farouk

Indication:
Endobronchial typical carcinoid in right middle lobe bronchus causing recurrent pneumonia.

Procedure:
Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking/excision of carcinoid (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Sedation:
Moderate sedation with propofol and fentanyl; LMA. ASA class II.

Findings:
Rounded, vascular mass at RML bronchus origin with ~70% obstruction.

Interventions:
Snare resection and forceps debulking were used to mechanically excise and debulk the tumor. No thermal ablation performed.

Hemostasis:
Controlled with cold saline; short application of topical epinephrine.

EBL:
20 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Discharged home the same day with antibiotics and follow-up in IP clinic in 4 weeks.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Endobronchial carcinoid in RML bronchus with recurrent infections.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Right middle lobe collapse with central obstructing endobronchial lesion.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of carcinoid tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Typical carcinoid tumor of the right middle lobe bronchus.

lines.selection_reason: Documentation supports mechanical debulking/excision (snare, forceps) without thermal ablation.

per_code.summary: Kept. Supported by explicit description of mechanical excision (snare, forceps) and absence of thermal ablation.

global_comments: Procedure involved purely mechanical debulking; CPT 31640 is appropriate.

note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY PROCEDURE NOTE – MECHANICAL DEBULKING OF TRACHEAL TUMOR

Patient: Kevin Brooks, 55-year-old male
MRN: S31640-022
Date: 2024-12-03
Location: Capital Regional Hospital – OR
Attending: Dr. Monica Shah

Indication:
Proximal tracheal tumor with noisy breathing and exertional dyspnea.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking/excision of proximal tracheal mass (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia with rigid tracheoscope. ASA class III.

Findings:
Sessile tumor on anterior proximal tracheal wall narrowing lumen to ~70%.

Interventions:
Rigid coring and forceps debulking removed most of the lesion. Snare resection used to excise a pedunculated portion. No ablation or balloon used.

Hemostasis:
Minimal; controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
15 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Extubated and discharged to PACU, then home later the same day.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Proximal tracheal tumor causing symptomatic airway narrowing.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Proximal tracheal soft tissue mass on CT.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of proximal tracheal tumor.

lines.selection_reason: Documentation supports mechanical debulking/excision (rigid coring, snare) without thermal ablation.

per_code.summary: Kept. Supported by explicit description of mechanical excision (rigid coring, snare) and absence of thermal ablation.

global_comments: Procedure involved purely mechanical debulking; CPT 31640 is appropriate.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT – MECHANICAL DEBULKING

Patient: Jonas Meyer, 66-year-old male
MRN: S31640-023
Date: 2025-01-09
Hospital: Pacific Coast Cancer Center – OR
Attending: Dr. Sabrina Cole

Indication:
Malignant obstruction of right mainstem bronchus from non–small cell lung cancer.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of right mainstem tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia; rigid bronchoscope. ASA class III.

Findings:
Tumor narrowing right mainstem lumen by ~85% with retained secretions.

Interventions:
Rigid coring and forceps debulking used to mechanically debulk and excise the tumor. No ablation or balloon dilation employed.

Hemostasis:
Moderate oozing controlled with cold saline and epinephrine.

EBL:
50 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Extubated and admitted to oncology floor.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Right mainstem central obstruction from non–small cell carcinoma.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Central right mainstem mass with partial right lung collapse.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of right mainstem tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Non–small cell lung carcinoma of right mainstem bronchus.

note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY PROCEDURE NOTE – MECHANICAL DEBULKING IN PATIENT WITH TRACHEOSTOMY

Patient: Natalie Ortiz, 62-year-old female
MRN: S31640-024
Date: 2025-01-27
Location: Coastal Veterans Hospital – Bronchoscopy Suite
Attending: Dr. William Nash

Indication:
Granulation tissue and tumor regrowth around tracheostomy stoma extending into tracheal lumen with dyspnea.

Procedure:
Flexible bronchoscopy via tracheostomy with mechanical debulking of granulation/tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Sedation:
Moderate sedation (midazolam, fentanyl) and topical lidocaine via tracheostomy; ASA class III.

Findings:
Granulation tissue and nodular tumor at distal tracheostomy site protruding into tracheal lumen (~60% obstruction).

Interventions:
Forceps debulking and snare resection were used to mechanically excise granulation and tumor tissue. No ablation used.

Hemostasis:
Mild; managed with cold saline.

EBL:
15 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Returned to ward on home ventilator settings; follow-up bronchoscopy planned in 6 weeks.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Tracheostomy-related granulation tissue and tumor regrowth causing tracheal obstruction.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT neck showing soft tissue around tracheostomy site protruding into tracheal lumen.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Flexible bronchoscopy via tracheostomy with mechanical debulking.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Mixed granulation tissue and recurrent tumor at tracheostomy site.

lines.selection_reason: Documentation supports mechanical debulking/excision (forceps, snare) without thermal ablation.

per_code.summary: Kept. Supported by explicit description of mechanical excision (forceps, snare) and absence of thermal ablation.

global_comments: Procedure involved purely mechanical debulking; CPT 31640 is appropriate.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY – MECHANICAL DEBULKING OF LMS MASS

Patient: Olivia Martin, 64-year-old female
MRN: S31640-025
Date: 2025-02-11
Hospital: Seaside Oncology Center – OR
Attending: Dr. Ravi Gupta

Indication:
Left mainstem endobronchial mass with near-complete obstruction and dyspnea at rest.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of left mainstem tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia; rigid bronchoscope. ASA class III.

Findings:
Bulky tumor at left mainstem origin narrowing lumen ~90%.

Interventions:
Rigid coring and forceps debulking were used to mechanically remove tumor. Microdebrider used for final debulking. No ablation.

Hemostasis:
Moderate oozing controlled with cold saline and epinephrine.

EBL:
55 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Extubated, admitted to step-down unit for close monitoring.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Near-complete left mainstem obstruction from endobronchial tumor.
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Left mainstem mass with almost complete obstruction and left lung collapse.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of left mainstem tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Endobronchial malignant tumor of the left mainstem bronchus.

lines.selection_reason: Documentation supports mechanical debulking/excision (rigid coring, microdebrider) without thermal ablation.

per_code.summary: Kept. Supported by explicit description of mechanical excision (rigid coring, microdebrider) and absence of thermal ablation.

global_comments: Procedure involved purely mechanical debulking; CPT 31640 is appropriate.

note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY PROCEDURE NOTE – MECHANICAL DEBULKING OF RLL BRONCHUS LESION

Patient: Marcus Allen, 58-year-old male
MRN: S31640-026
Date: 2025-02-26
Institution: Highland Pulmonary Center – Bronchoscopy Suite
Attending: Dr. Grace Nguyen

Indication:
Right lower lobe endobronchial lesion with recurrent post-obstructive pneumonia.

Procedure:
Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking/excision of RLL bronchus lesion (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Sedation:
Moderate sedation (propofol, fentanyl) via LMA; ASA class II.

Findings:
Polypoid lesion at superior segment RLL bronchus with ~70% obstruction.

Interventions:
Snare resection and forceps debulking used to mechanically remove the lesion. No thermal ablation or balloon dilation.

Hemostasis:
Minimal; controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
10 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Discharged home after observation; follow-up CT and bronchoscopy planned.

registry_entry.radiographic_findings: RLL consolidation and central lesion on CT.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of RLL lesion.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Endobronchial lesion of RLL bronchus (pathology pending).

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY – RIGID BRONCHOSCOPY WITH MECHANICAL DEBULKING

Patient: Sofia Delgado, 50-year-old female
MRN: S31640-027
Date: 2025-03-13
Hospital: Union Square Medical Center – OR
Attending: Dr. Alan Foster

Indication:
Mixed carinal and left mainstem obstruction from endobronchial lung cancer.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of carinal/LMS tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia; rigid bronchoscope. ASA class III.

Findings:
Tumor projecting from left side of carina into LMS with ~80% obstruction.

Interventions:
Rigid coring and forceps debulking to mechanically debulk tumor at carina and LMS. No thermal ablation.

Hemostasis:
Controlled with cold saline and epinephrine.

EBL:
40 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Extubated and admitted to step-down unit.

registry_entry.bronch_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of central tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Centrally obstructing lung carcinoma involving carina and left mainstem.

note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY PROCEDURE NOTE – MECHANICAL DEBULKING

Patient: Henry Thompson, 72-year-old male
MRN: S31640-028
Date: 2025-03-31
Facility: Riverbend Community Hospital – Bronchoscopy Suite
Attending: Dr. Leah Simmons

Indication:
Post-intubation tracheal stenosis with progressive dyspnea.

Procedure:
Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of granulation tissue (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Sedation:
Moderate sedation with midazolam and fentanyl; topical lidocaine. ASA class III.

Findings:
Short circumferential granulation ring in distal trachea causing 60–70% narrowing.

Interventions:
Forceps debulking and snare resection used to mechanically excise granulation tissue. No balloon or ablation.

Hemostasis:
Minimal; controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
5 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Discharged home after observation; follow-up bronchoscopy in 2–3 months.

registry_entry.radiographic_findings: Distal tracheal narrowing on CT consistent with post-intubation scar.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of benign tracheal stenosis.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Benign post-intubation tracheal stenosis with granulation tissue.

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY – RIGID BRONCHOSCOPY WITH MECHANICAL DEBULKING

Patient: David Price, 63-year-old male
MRN: S31640-029
Date: 2025-04-15
Hospital: Meridian Cancer Institute – OR
Attending: Dr. Julia Harper

Indication:
Left mainstem endobronchial tumor with recurrent post-obstructive pneumonia and weight loss.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking/excision of left mainstem tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia; rigid bronchoscope; ASA class III.

Findings:
Friable LMS mass causing 80–85% obstruction.

Interventions:
Rigid coring, forceps debulking, and microdebrider used for mechanical debulking and excision. No thermal methods.

Hemostasis:
Moderate oozing controlled with cold saline and epinephrine.

EBL:
60 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Extubated and admitted to oncology ward.

registry_entry.bronch_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of LMS tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Endobronchial malignant tumor of the left mainstem.

note_text:
BRONCHOSCOPY PROCEDURE NOTE – MECHANICAL DEBULKING IN PATIENT WITH MALIGNANT TRACHEAL TUMOR

Patient: Chloe Bennett, 48-year-old female
MRN: S31640-030
Date: 2025-04-30
Facility: Horizon Academic Medical Center – OR
Attending: Dr. Miguel Alvarez

Indication:
Proximal/mid tracheal tumor with progressive stridor and exertional dyspnea.

Procedure:
Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking/excision of tracheal tumor (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia:
General anesthesia; rigid bronchoscope; ASA class III.

Findings:
Tumor involving anterior and lateral walls of mid trachea, causing ~75% narrowing.

Interventions:
Rigid coring and forceps debulking used to mechanically debulk and excise tumor tissue. Snare resection of a pedunculated component. No thermal ablation.

Hemostasis:
Mild; controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
20 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Extubated and discharged to step-down unit for overnight monitoring.

registry_entry.bronch_indication: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of mid-tracheal tumor.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Malignant tracheal tumor causing central airway obstruction.
